posts.post_content:
Seton, Patron Wizard, Master Apothecary and...?
  
   
What gives? Where are the red and black 3-mana "tap a guy" tribal lords?
posts.html:
Seton, Patron Wizard, Master Apothecary and...?

What gives? Where are the red and black 3-mana "tap a guy" tribal lords?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Kirbster (9/4/2010 3:14:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Thing to take away from Seton is that unlike Llanowar Elves, the tap ability is not hindered by summoning sickness. There's no tap symbol, it is merely an activated ability that says Tap an untapped druid you control. So you could get mana out of them a turn earlier.
posts.html:
Thing to take away from Seton is that unlike Llanowar Elves, the tap ability is not hindered by summoning sickness. There's no tap symbol, it is merely an activated ability that says Tap an untapped druid you control. So you could get mana out of them a turn earlier.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Nagoragama (9/8/2010 7:08:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Well, the good thing is that you can tap him for his own ability the turn he comes into play.
posts.html:
Well, the good thing is that you can tap him for his own ability the turn he comes into play.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: majinara (10/15/2010 1:08:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The shame is that most playable druids are already of the [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) kind of ability, so there's not much to abuse this guy with.  
  
I'm tempted to try an figure out a way to make him work for EDH, he seems like a reasonable [Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary).
posts.html:
The shame is that most playable druids are already of the Llanowar Elves kind of ability, so there's not much to abuse this guy with.

I'm tempted to try an figure out a way to make him work for EDH, he seems like a reasonable Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary.
